intro: Hieracium loxolepis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium loxolepis is an annual or biennial plant, known for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
